para: This option instructs the duplicate filter to identify and remove waypoints that have the same short name as a waypoint that has already been processed. This comparison is case-sensitive.

This is one of the primary modes of the duplicate filter. It is useful for merging datasets that may have overlapping waypoints, ensuring that each unique waypoint name appears only once in the output. By default, only the second and subsequent occurrences of a waypoint are removed.

example.title: Merge two GPX files and remove duplicate waypoints by name

para.userinput: gpsbabel -i gpx -f file1.gpx -i gpx -f file2.gpx -x duplicate,shortname -o gpx -F merged.gpx
